comment: Professor Hagin was probably the best professor I have ever had. He taught me not only to write better, but to communicate and argue effectively. If you ever find him teaching again, even if it is at another school, take him. You will not regret it. He really takes the time to work with you and make sure you know what you need to do.

He gives you everything he ask of you online nearly organized. He is very thorough grader but tells you exactly what you will be graded on for each assignment.  If you bring your paper to him and ask for help he will make sure you get an A on the paper.

Very, very longwinded. Extremely slow in grading and passing back papers, which are alot(8-10) in a 1st level ENG class.Pushes back due dates. However, is very helpful & insightful if you come to him outside of class. Doesn't really teach out oany textbook....which could be detrimental down the road in your later Eng classes.

I absolutely LOVE this professor! He is NOT an easy grader, but it really does help. You do have to work hard. But if you ask his for help, he is more than happy to tell you exactly what he wants. Attendance is very mandatory, but if you show up, it pays off in the end. I will definately be taking him again and recommend that others do too!

slow about returning papers in which you have at least 8 that's due during the semester. longwinded and gives sarcastic retorts in a passive aggressive manner when you ask a question. do not take him! you won't learn a think in his class..

mr. hagin is a nice guy to get your help in ur subject. he is always willing to give anything extra that students might need. he replies his emails pretty fast answers any query that has been asked although he gets picky sometimes but that is actually good for the students as we can get focused for what he is actually asking for.

This professor is probably the most arrogant man I have ever met. His assignments are not only pointless, but difficult at that. He takes weeks to grade papers and assigns roughly 6-9 papers per semester. I am not one of the students who failed his class and is writing a horrible response. I made a solid B and nearly hated the class. Do not take!
RUN! Drop if you're already signed up. Worst Prof at KSU.
The man is not flexible at all. He will not help you if you need it and helps others who don't need it.
No.

Worst class I've ever had in my entire life.  There is an  extreme amount of reading about ancient Sumeria, Egypt, and East Asia.  His tests are ridiculous because you have to cite the page numbers of the text you are referring to on his essay questions.  AVOID this class like the plague.

VERY HARD! if you are a slacker or procrastinate at all, do NOT take him. he will make you a better writer, but you have to be willing to become one. he is very opinionated and is hard to see eye to eye with. i worked hard and only made a C. also, attendance is mandatory, he makes you feel like a failure if you miss a class.

Avoid taking him if possible. He is an extremely helpful teacher and will make you a better writer, however I worked my butt off and spent many sleepless nights finishing his numerous papers he assigns and I only got a B

Requires a lot of reading. Weekly quizzes (open note but it won't do you much good b/c he covers the material AFTER you take the quiz). Wrote his own book that YOU have to print yourself on your printer- a waste of $ for ink. He's offensive. Likes to intimidate his students. A disgrace to KSU.
Seriously, I have to agree with the comment a few rows below...think he's writing the good reviews. This Prof is a nightmare. Avoid Him.

AWESOME teacher. Picks stories that are interesting and is really willing to help struggling students. Very approachable and makes time available. 3 tests and a final and weekly quizzes. He curves all the tests plus they are open book and open note. Definantly would recommend him!

EVERYTHING you need to know to succeed is in the notes on his website and his free course packet.  Only way to fail is by not reading or by responding to every question with "Jesus is the answer."  Take World History first so you get a contextual understanding of the stories; it helps a LOT on the weekly quizzes and monthly tests.

I have read all of the reviews and honestly, I think HE'S writing the good ones. He is offensive and arrogant. He requires a massive amount of work and grades based on what he wants to hear. I even used his own words in a paper & he marked it wrong. Extremely picky. Lectures the entire class and it is a waste of time. Ridiculous man- Avoid him!!!

He obviously doesn't care that you have other classes. He assigns paper probably one after the other. I have other classes that require the same amount of priority, but that doesn't matter: I have to work on my paper. If you love not sleeping, go for it.

Great teacher and quite possibly the most helpful teacher I've ever had even through grade school. His papers require a lot of critical thinking. You can miss up to 5 days in the class or else you fail (it is a law for all english classes now) Overall, I made a B and was very pleased.
Very nice teacher. Took him for engl 1101 and he is very helpful and assignments and it is very clear on what he wants.

Overall he is a good teacher, but his lectures are never ending. Could use a little more class involvement. The quizzes and tests are hard until you figure out what he is looking for you to write. He is very willing to help. I would recommend someone else is English isn't your best subject though.

Good teacher but very opinionated.  I could never get my opinions to agree with his, so it did not help me very much on his papers but he cares a lot about English and will help you if you need it.  Loves to lecture and talk a lot in the class

Class is veryyy opinionated. You can tell he is a democrat and if he doesn't like your opinions, your grade will show it. He talks forever pretty much all class. Everything is on his website, there is no point in coming to class except he takes attendance. He is very clear with what he expects and wants.
awesome teacher...so very willing to work with anyone that needs help

Very helpful, easy class... got an A did not read anything.  I listened to his lectures and then used what he said to answer all quiz and test questions.  I did not get anything below a 100 on any test.  If you are good at rephrasing things and adding in your own interpretation you will pass if you turn in your quizzes and take the test.

People giving Dr. Hagin bad reviews are out of their mind. He does want you to spit back out exactly what he tells you, but that's not so bad. He tells you exactly what he wants. I made an 88 without ever reading any of the books, just looked through notes and handouts for answers to quizzes. Put forth some minimal effort, you will get an A.

dude is the worst teacher i've come across.I went from averging an A to finishing with a D, all because of my attendance.WTF?This isn't high school.I'm a grown man + i pay my own damn fees.He never grades you on your writing level, only on opinions.If he doesn't like your opinion, you are definitely failing.Total jerk. Avoid at all costs.

VERY HARD TEACHER.  It is a very opinionated class, but your opinion doesn't matter.  If you think that one of the readings means one thing, and you have evidence to back it up, but it still isn't what he thinks... YOU WILL NOT RECIEVE CREDIT.  Cares to much about his website... doesn't clearify ANYTHING!!

Will not like your opinions if they are not in line with his; grades you on your opinions instead of your writing skill; teaches class more like a sermon than English; biased as hell; comes off in conferences as a near communist.  If you are a liberal he will love you.  If you are a conservative or even a neo-liberal, he will try to kill your view.

The Hardest Teacher I have ever had! I felt like no matter what i did i couldn't get a 5/5 on a question. It usually ended up being a 3/5 with very few 4/5. I ended up withdrawing from the class because I needed to keep Hope and couldn't afford a low grade. DON'T TAKE HIM

The best professor at KSU. He LOVES what he does and he truly cares about his students. His class is very deep and will make a positive impact in your life. It is a lot of reading and work, but it's well worth it. Because his tests are open book, print out his notes from the website and bring them to class. Be sure you come to class!!!

He is a very hard grader. No matter if I studied, I could never get above a C because he "doesn't agree." I could write 5 paragraphs for a question that only requires 2 and he would STILL say "Give me more." Other than that, he is Very enthusiastic and explains all the literature very well and in a way that you can understand it. LOTS of material!

Bias,Leaves no room for personal opinion which makes the assignments very uniteresting.Overwhelming amount of work.Requires LOTS time outside class. He is very attentive and a great person but I would not recommend his class!!
Crazy amount of class material, good class grades on a curve, you going to write and write and write and write.... get the point.
Mr. Hagin is an amazing professor. I would definately recommend taking him for world lit. He made the class interesting. It is a hard class but since it's required, take him! He makes it fun!
Awesome guy, you can tell he loves what he does. He is very attentive and will go out of his way to help students.But he assigns way too much work and grades very harsh!!
Very fun class.Laid back prof. Sensitive to our budgets, lack of sleep, so on.

Incredible professor. He will help you do your best. The only things to take note of beforehand is that there is an attendance policy (6 absenses = fail). It's a mythology class so if you're VERY religious, refuse to try to understand stories from older cultures, or are very offended by sex references, you may want to reconsider.

This professor is fantastic. He listens and cares for his students. He makes sure they are grasping the material and has an incredible enthusiasm for his subject. I highly enjoy every class I have with him because of his jokes; you actually want to learn the material. He brings up interesting material and the novels he chooses are thought provoking

Excellent reading and clear instruction. Professor provides incredible notes both in-class and online. READ. STUDY. Prof. is very into the material and passionate about sharing his knowledge. Lots of pertinent information. Will be in class for the entire time but Prof. utilizes time well. Attend every class!!!

He is a great teacher. He really cares about his students! Attendance is mandatory, take home quiz each week, and three tests. You must go to class, not only because it is mandatory, but because he goes over every reading and pretty much tells you the answers to the quizzes.
Really cares about his students.
Excellent! You must keep up with the readings and do the quizes, but it's worth it. I found this class very interesting and Hagin is a great teacher, very helpful, enthusiastic and understanding.

Great class, makes learning fun. thouroughly explains material and leaves room for questions. open book tests and weekly take home quizes. there are enough grades to do really well in the end if it takes time for you to catch on in the beginning. I highly recommend him! (FYI there is an attendance policy)

He gave a great class. Lectures were interesting, the homework was pertinent to the testing material, and the class was fun all-around. He's a really nice guy and will help you in any way possible to get through what you need to do.

He is a great guy, very enthusiastic. The material is boring(to me anyway theyre just ancient stories)but just pay attention in class and you will do well. All tests are open notes, so just print off his summaries online and keep up with 'em. The quizzes are take home, and to me the quizzes were harder than the tests. But I definitely recomend him.

Yeah, so I pretty much hated this class.  As an English major, I didn't feel the need to come to class that much, and got a bad grade for that.  All he talks about is how much he hates Wal-Mart and China.  Hello, it's English, not Economics!  We DON'T CARE!

great proffesor, very clear and organized. no papers, all test and quizes are open book/note. test are essay, but they are not diffucult. he is available if you need extra help.Readings due weekly, and quiz weekly. I would suggest taking the (only meet once a week) class

Mr. Hagin is EXTREMELY organized which helps a ton. He tells you exactly what to expect and makes very clear what he wants from assignments. He's a genious, so you can't pull anything over on him. I learned a lot from the course and recommned him to everyone who wants to learn.No tests, just papers.He's not nearly as strict as what others have said

This teacher is very weird.  I don't understand all of the positive responses. He is very anal.  Starts class and ends it on time to the second (watches his watch and everything).  He counts off towards your grade if you are late or miss class.
A fun class and a fun professor!  He really knows how to grab the class's attention.
No Comments
No Comments

I found this class to be hard.  lots of reading very time consumming you have to buy I think 6 books to read. Nice person but tons of material. Horriable attendence policy! Stay clear of him if you want to miss even one day of class
good teacher; helps out

My best teacher so far at KSU. He really cares about you and the international students.He will do everything to make sure you understand the material. He always is available to answer questions on the day before the exam.So, don't miss it, because he will go over on what will be on the exam.
Great Teacher!

One of the best teachers at KSU.  Very nice and probably the most organized teacher you'll ever have.  Gives lots of handouts to keep you organized. Class isn't that hard either.  took him for comp 1 and world lit. Your writing skills will improve too. Highly recommended.

He is an awesome teacher, but fair warning... if you have a hard time with tieing things together and finding symbolic representation or problems with metaphors stay away.... overall awesome professor

mr. hagin is a really nice guy but he is so into the material its scary.i took his class on a friday and he ALWAYS took up the whole time. he gives a quiz every week and also gives about 4 hrs. of reading each week.very organized but also very annoying at times.

He wants everyone to learn the material.  But believe me don't miss his class for anything!  He is very picky about being absent and tardies.  He deducts points even if you have a dr. note. If you like to miss class don't take him. Be ready to READ ALOT. He will help you in anyway but lot of materia
He is very helpful. He posts all notes on the internet and he will help you!!!  He is very kind also.
biased on most all issues

"Rate my professor" let me down on this one.  I took this teacher b/c of the comments here.  I dropped the class after a month.  He is a cntrl freak.  You get pts off for missing a day, even with a dr's note.  You will be in class to the  very s

Be ready to read tons of material.  If you read and keep perfect attendance, the tests are easy (open note/book).  He's very helpful and courteous - class summaries are posted online (*hint: great for test days!).  You'll definitely learn a lot.

Very organized and nice teacher. He posts ALL of his notes online- great for tests. Always willing to help you out, he is one of the nicest teachers I've ever had. Just make sure you show up to all the classes.
Very nice and works with you. Cool about missing class and everything is soooo organized, also everything online. Very good teacher!
Very nice and organized, easy even if you don't always go to class!
comes recommended, very intelligent
